page.title: 07MERLIN 2/FARMING
page.content: Porth to St Columb.It goes 1 mile through Merlin.Merlin has 272 acres of land,150 for corn,80 for barley and 70 for wheat.There are 30 of woodland and 30 for hay to feed animals.They have about 30 horses but none on livery. Merlin was built at the end of the 17th Century.Only 3 of the original buildings still stand,the barn,holiday house and the farmhouse.sometimes they have French students for riding holidays.They come from different parts of France but mainly Paris.In winter they have 1 person to help at the stables and 1 workman.In summer they have 4 in the stables and hire a qualified riding instructress. {FARMING}There are 4 main farms in our area:Carnewas,Trenance,Brepen,New Farm There is also a thriving farm supplies Higher Denzell Farm is owned by Clive Richardson who employs 5 people all
